conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand how the position and size of the shadows (A, B, and C) change when the light source moves to the right above the objects.

Shadow A is cast by the birdcage.
Shadow B is cast by the skull.

When the light source moves to the right, the direction of the light rays will change. This will affect the position and size of the shadows.

premise: When the light source moves to the right, the direction of the light rays will change.
conclusion: As the light source moves to the right, the shadows will shift to the left (opposite direction of the light source movement).

premise: The size of the shadows will depend on the distance of the objects from the new light source.
conclusion: If the objects are closer to the new light source, their shadows will be smaller. If they are farther away, their shadows will be larger.
